title: Break in world history and low-wage laborers

content.question: Historians argue that the twentieth century marks a significant break in world history for all of the following reasons EXCEPT:

choices.label: Petroleum use fundamentally changed the relationship of humans to the environment.
The population of the world increased from 1.6 billion to 6.1 billion people.
Communists established powerful new states in Russia and China.
Low-wage laborers migrated from continent to continent.

content.answer: Low-wage laborers migrated from continent to continent.

topic.text: 9.2: Technological Advances and Limitations after 1900 - Disease

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
